oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Miss Nashville Pageant contestants with Mayor Ben West and Pat Boone, 1954
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Pictured: Four 1954 Miss Nashville Pageant contestants posing with Mayor Ben West and entertainer Pat Boone. Charles Eugene “Pat” Boone (born June 1, 1934) was born in Jacksonville, Florida and his family moved to Nashville when he was two years old. He attended and graduated from David Lipscomb High School in 1952, then next enrolled in David Lipscomb College. Pat Boone began recording for Nashville’s Republic Records in 1954. One of the convertible cars in this photo displays a sign that reads: “Pat Boone, Republic Records, Three Times Winner of the Ted Mack Program.” Another sign reads: “Mary Ann Lawrence, sponsored by Popcorn Village.” Forms part of Record Group 3, Metro Davidson County Photographer. 1 photograph negative : b & w ; 4 x 5 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: West, Ben, 1911-1974; Boone, Pat; Lawrence, Mary Ann
